alert.note: Alert for Hamilton; Suwannee (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 5:25PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Suwannee and west central Hamilton Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 524 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Dowling Park, or 12 miles southwest of Suwannee River State Park, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds around 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Suwannee River State Park, Dowling Park, Blue Springs, Luraville and Newburn. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
